abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Science and
            Technical Education Post-Basic Project is to support
            Nigerian federal post-basic education and research
            sub-sector in producing more and better qualified science
            and technology (S&T) graduates, and higher quality and
            more relevant research. The changes are based on the
            extensive discussions held with Government of Nigeria (GoN)
            during the Mid Term Review, or MTR (February 12-25, 2010) of
            the project and a request dated August 31, 2009 for
            reallocation from GON. After a delay of about one year, the
            project is now on track. As of MTR, about 37.8 percent of
            funds are disbursed. Another 25 percent are committed,
            mainly for establishment of nine Centers of Excellence (CoE)
            in critical S&T areas for Nigeria chosen from 93
            proposals. The MTR rated the project to be moderately
            satisfactory with a potential of upgrading to Satisfactory
            soon after release of the grants awarded to CoE (component
            two) and commencement of planned studies for systemic
            reforms (component three). Component one covering about 200
            institutions is progressing well. Project management,
            procurement, and monitoring and evaluation (M&E) are
            rated moderately satisfactory. Counterpart funding,
            safeguards compliance are rated satisfactory. There is no
            audit overdue. The project is in general compliance of all
            legal covenants.
